data.title: Union Community School District
data.meta_description: Welcome to Union High School. Union High School is a rural public school district located in northeastern Iowa with approximately 370 students and 45 staff members.
data.text:
Welcome to Union High School, home of the Knights! Union High School is a public high school located in La Porte City, IA with approximately 300 students and 40 staff members. UHS serves the communities of La Porte City and Dysart.

My name is Jason Toenges and I currently serve as the high school principal. Before coming to Union, I served as the elementary and high school principal at MMCRU in northwest Iowa. Before entering into administration, I taught social studies and was an instructional coach in St. Louis, MO and Houston, TX. I am originally from Algona, IA.

UHS operates on a semester schedule (8-period day/43 minutes each). We offer many co-curricular and extracurricular opportunities such as FFA, NHS, Drama, Choir, Band, Dance Team, Cheerleading, Speech, and Silver Cord (Community Service Volunteer Opportunities).

At Union, we believe all students can and will be successful. UHS offers a wide variety of courses for all learners including college classes, career and technical education courses, core and co-curricular academic opportunities. In addition to our many course offerings, UHS recognizes students for their academic excellence at the end of each semester.

UHS offers many IAHSAA (boy’s athletic union) & IGHSAU (girl’s athletic union) sports such as cross country (boys/girls), volleyball, swimming (boys/girls), football, basketball (boys/girls), wrestling, track (boys/girls), soccer (boys/girls), golf (boys/girls), tennis (boys/girls), baseball, and softball.

Union High School students are expected to be respectful, be involved, and take pride in our school community. Union High School staff and student body are committed to maintaining a strong school culture that values relationships and collaboration among staff and students.
